‘Sell America’ Trade Picks Up After New Trump Threats on Fed
summary: P.M. Edition for April 21. U.S. markets were on edge about President Trump's tariff war as well as his threats to fire Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell. Stocks fell, the dollar hit fresh multiyear lows against major currencies, and yields on longer-term Treasurys rose. Plus, U.S. megabanks are built for business from all corners of the globe. Heard on the Street columnist

title: TNB Tech Minute: Japan Accuses Google of Being Anticompetitive
summary: Plus: JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Bank of New York Mellon press pause on electronic communications with their regulator following an email hack. And Johnson & Johnson says tariffs will increase costs for its medical-technology products. Victoria Craig hosts.

title: Japan Regulator Orders Google to Stop Anticompetitive Practices
summary: Japan’s antitrust regulator instructed Alphabet’s Google to stop what it said are anticompetitive practices involving mobile search services, its first order against a U.S. technology giant.

title: Google Offers to Tweak Automotive Services, Maps Contracts to Appease German Regulator
summary: The company said it would license the services contained in its Google Automotive Services business as separate stand-alone versions.
